title: All the windows in the client are black (also freezes after login for 30 seconds to a minute)
body:
Hey,
Whenever I log-in to league's client for the first time, my entire computer freezes up, sometimes the mouse can't even move and sometimes it can but won't click or drag or do anything, when it starts running again (30-60 seconds later) all the windows in the client will be black and won't show up even after games. 
When i quit and log back in, all the windows will load correctly and it won't freeze. not major, had it for a while, wondering if there is a fix or if anyone else has the problem.

replies.body:
What sort of computer do you have, and what OS did you install on it? Is it fairly recent?

Did you have any issues with the initial installation of the game (such as error dialogues or DirectX failing to install)?

Have you ever run this game before on any device?

Windows 7 home premium 64bit, SP1.
it's not really recently built, but it's not a bad computer, maybe needs a bit more RAM.
intel core i7 930 @ 2.8GHz
6GB RAM
Radeon HD 5970

Never had issues with the install, and if I did I would either repair it or reinstall it from scratch, I've repaired it a couple of times with it not getting fixed.

My brother plays it fine on his computer in his room of the house, it used to run fine on my computer until a certain patch, i don't remember which patch.

So it was working fine at one point but now it's no longer functioning.

Have you tried updating Windows itself (I advise that you do not install any graphic or audio hardware updates from Microsoft, they're usually outdated and not functioning)? Have you tried running the game in admin mode?

I've kept everything up to date, and I only update hardware through their own websites or applications.

Just tried admin mode, nothing changed, it did lock up completely for longer, needing me to 'ctrl+alt+del' to get a response 15 seconds later. but that may have just been a coincidence.

Are you able to get to the patcher at least? Could you try repairing?

You can also try defragging your computer. In severe cases of fragmentation, programs will start to slow-down and perhaps even freeze like you mentioned.

I've tried repairing and fragmenting before and again now.
No progress.

Also, I never said I've been stuck at the patcher, or anywhere.

Sorry, I misinterpreted the information, and that is entirely my fault.

Have you tried changing your display settings? Using 60Hz or 50Hz as your refresh rate and a resolution of 1280x720 (even just once) might fix it permanently.

Also, use Window's native tool to scan your hard-drive for errors. You can do this by right-clicking your Local Drive and then clicking on the "Tools" tab. Suggest you make a back-up of it first, and its repair *may* delete files.

This next one might be a no-brainer, but do you have any other applications open while running League? Even things such as automatic maintenance or background virus scanners can cause huge lag on a computer, because most of them don't really expect you to be playing video-games on them.

Try cleaning your registry with a program like CCleaner.

As a desparate move, you can try [reinstalling the game](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/202539040-Reinstalling-League-of-Legends) (be sure to [back-up your item sets](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752904-Item-Sets-#h4q1) and config files!). However, you're eventually getting the game up, so it's up to you whether you want to go through all of that or not.

Best of luck.
